p: HMEC-1 (human microvascular endothelial cells) were purchased from ATCC (Rockville, MD, USA), catalog number ATCC-CRL-10636 (depositor Centers for Disease Control, Dr. Edwin W. Ades, Atlanta). For experimentation, the cells between passages 10–31 were used. HMEC-1 cells were cultured in 25 cm 3 flasks in MCDB 131 medium that was supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA), 10 ng/mL epidermal growth factor, 1 μg/mL hydrocortisone and penicillin-streptomycin solution (Sigma-Aldrich Chemical Co. Ltd., St. Louis, MO, USA), in a humidified atmosphere of 95% and 5% CO 2 at 37 °C. Cells were harvested every third day in a trypsin-EDTA solution (0.25% trypsin, 1 mM EDTA). HMEC-1 cells were cultured according to the method described in the literature [ 22], and the author’s own modification [ 23].
